Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean”
Reviews.Author: halrhp
Reviews.Content: Close to airport, good shuttle service, clean. Useful for an overnight stopover between flights (which is what i was doing there). Noisy air conditioner with only low and high settings. so typical of so many hotels these days. These units should be outlawed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy F
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast.. You got to make your own waffles which was quite an experience with my family. Great fitness room too, but the room I got was disgusting. Moth balls everywhere, moths everywhere, spiders all over the bathroom floor, and what really got me pissed was I saw a little nasty creepy crawly bug in my bed. And for that reason I will not go back to that dirty place nor recommend it to anyone I like. The lady came in, and made my bed, so if I saw that bug I'm sure she probably did too, and that's trifiling if she didn't even care. I don't care what anyone else says building 10 was just plain nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience ..”
Reviews.Author: catsmamaplus1
Reviews.Content: Rooms where clean.Staff was very friendly.Great price for the room.I would highly recommend..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Roy V
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! Price seemed too low for what I got. Stayed for a week, and found out all the rooms have a full kitchen. location was perfect for going to downtown and uptown. Def thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “The true meaning of DUMP”
Reviews.Author: Gwen P
Reviews.Content: This establishment was very bad. I stayed here for a convention in Dallas because someone was looking to share space, little did I know. The sofa-bed as it turned out was like laying on a rock bed and can't imagine anyone being able to sleep on it. Cleaning service was a whim at best. We were told by the airline there was free shuttle service to town, we were told not at the hotel. They didn't go over 5 miles, it was 5.7 to the conference. The only friendly face was the attendant in the dining area (if that's the right name for it). Bad experience! Police, arrest, scary looking people.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TransplantedBuckeye
Reviews.Content: Went off season. Got great rate on a large suite with a bedroom, living room with fireplace and kitchen. The walk in closet was almost a room by itself. The unit was older but in good condition. The area was offices and fairly quiet at night. Breakfast and a week night meal were included . Nothing fancy but a good light snack that included a salad and wine. Quite a deal for $70 a night. Only negative was no exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price for New Years!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjohnson08
Reviews.Content: Wanted a change of scenary, so my husband and I booked a room at the Hawthorne. All of the surrounding hotels were charging $100 plus for 1 night for New Years Eve, but at the Hawthorne website they had rooms for only $59 a night. Upon arrival the hotel looked like an apartment complex, which I liked. The suites looked like an effienciency apartment, with a small living area with a pull out sofa and a flat screen tv that swiveled so that you could watch in either the bedroom or the living room if you wanted to, a patio, a nice size bathroom, a full kitchen with bar/bar stools, a king bed, and a large walk-in closet. It was definitely a place I could stay in long term if necessary. I wish I had taken pictures, but for the money, I was pretty impressed. Now its not the nicest suite I have ever stayed in but I would definitely stay here again because it really was nice and very comfortable and the location was fantastic. We were minutes from the freeway, the nightlife, and neighboring cities. The only thing I disliked was their breakfast. The itenarary the hotel staff gave was that breakfast was served from like 7 to 9 and was a buffet, and bc my husband loves breakfast, I thought this was bonus, but when we got there they only had hard boiled eggs (no scrambles eggs, like the paper said) rubbery bacon, gritty sausage, biscuits and toast (no pancakes or waffles, like the paper said), cereal, juice and coffee, and none of it was really good, so with that I was not happy, but the overall stay was good. I just know if I choose this hotel again, to either fix my breakfast in my room or go out to eat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: lamorgan55
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised. Apparently this was an apartment complex that is a hotel. Nice sized suites with fireplaces and kitchens. They have evening meals and breakfast - nothing fancy, but enough to get by. Price was very reasonable. I definitely recommend, especially for the business person.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Made our Stay Great”
Reviews.Author: EmileaS
Reviews.Content: Most of all, the staff were the best part of our stay. The price was extremely reasonable, and any small deficiencies in the amenities was not an inconvenience. There was a small problem with wifi connection, but the manager came out and tried to fix it right away. Decent morning breakfast. Very comfortable bed. We enjoyed our suite with a full kitchen - full size fridge and microwave, as we were staying for 4 days. But once more, a special thank you to Britney, Steven and the Manager (sorry, forgot your name).

Reviews.Title: “Big, clean, quiet room!”
Reviews.Author: LASusie
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here for it's proximity to the Convention Center and low price and it was a nice surprise. A huge room with sofa and full kitchen and patio. Very comfortable and spotless! It's a little out of the way and in little groupings of a few rooms instead of a long corridor so it was very quiet. Breakfast was just ok,and they did have a light dinner in the evening but it needs to be replenished more often as several of the items were out when he went down and no one was checking on it. A great place for families!

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, Great value”
Reviews.Author: Jaci C
Reviews.Content: My company stayed at Hawthorn Suites last week. The rooms were huge and it was really nice to have a kitchen and living area so we could all hangout in each other's rooms. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful. They were the most accommodating hotel staff I have ever worked with. Besides being a 15 minute ride to down town, this hotel is a great option for a comfortable, affordable trip to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Annette R
Reviews.Content: I am sometimes leary about reviews written on here especially when they're REALLY good. But I must say, this is the BEST experience I have had while on a business trip to Dallas. I was at a Mary Kay convention at the Dallas Conv. Ctr end of July, early Aug and by far, this is the place to stay. We had our own vehicle, so driving back and forth to the convention wasn't a problem. The staff is very friendly, the facility is clean. Very spacious, home feeling of our townhome style accomodations. Really like the kitchen, which afforded us the opportunity to cook on the one night the hotel didn't serve an evening meal. The FULL breakfast is well worth it as well (not just a continential breakfast, REAL eggs, bacon, etc). Although the convention served breakfast, the hotel was a much better meal. I will DEFINATELY stay here again and HIGHLY recommend it to others as well. We have found our newest favorite place to stay whil in Dallas and will definately try to find other Hawthorn Suites when traveling to other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daffodildazy
Reviews.Content: Very large room, 1 bedroom with bathroom upstairs and another with bathroom downstairs, so lots of room. Good breakfast, friendly staff and very useful laundrette. Could do with a bit of an upgrade but good value for the price. A few miles out of the city, but not too far.

Reviews.Title: “large rooms friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: joannam2011
Reviews.Content: We arrived here at the hawthorn on 9-5-2011 and are still currently here. We have a 2 bedroom 2 full baths with a full kitchen. A t.v in each room. A full hot breakfast and lite dinner is complimentary. The staff is very friendly... You cannot beat the price here...The roads here in Dallas are not in the best of shape so be careful when driving. The hawthorn does provide free shuttle within a 5 mile radius. They accept dogs with a one time 50.00 fee. They also have small gym and a small pool. Great place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Would love to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: bustraveller010
Reviews.Content: I recently moved to Dallas and needed a place to stay for a week before moving into my new apartment. I stumbled upon the Hawthorn Suites based on the great Tripadvisor reviews (and the affordable price). I was amazed at the value (I stayed in a room with a full kitchen). There is a complimentary social hour (which saved me quite a bit in buying dinner). The staff was extremely friendly (John and Elias). Would definitely stay here again and will have all my out of town guests stay here. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda L
Reviews.Content: Last week, a co-worker and I were in Dallas for work and stayed at the Hawthorn suites. We were very pleased with our decision. Being two females, we were a bit apprehensive about travelling on our own, but the staff at Hawthorn made us feel completely safe. They were extremely friendly and went above and beyond to ensure that we felt at home. They ensured that were able to reach our destination safely everyday and they helped us pick great restaurants. The room and washroom were impecable and were cleaned on a daily basis. Im not a huge fan of air conditioning (I like it warmer than the average person). When I mentioned this to a staff member, she personally ensured that the temperature in the room was to my liking. I was so impressed! The list could go on but its probably suffice to say that a hotel is only as good as the service that is provided and this hotel definitely exceeded my expectations. I will definitely be returning to the Hawthorn suites!

Reviews.Title: “Long term stay”
Reviews.Author: Becky N
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for several weeks this summer and was lucky to find this hotel. The price was good and the room had a full kitchen. I saved a lot of money being able to go grocery shopping and make my own dinner. The staff was all very personable. They knew my name and always called me by name. In the evenings they have a free 'evening reception' where I could grab dinner and hang out after a day of work. Thanks a lot to everyone who made my stay so pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “I liked the stay :)”
Reviews.Author: Vandy85
Reviews.Content: though I was staying alone, I did not have any problem coz of the staff out there who are very friendly and co-operative. Regards, Vandana

Reviews.Title: “It was cheap for the area and had a kitchen!!”
Reviews.Author: cali_vally_gurl
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and I loved the white fluffy hotel sheets its exactly what I needed after standing all day at a wedding. Check in was easy and there was plenty space in the room, we just had 2 women and felt safe staying here alone.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable deal, what a blessing!”
Reviews.Author: xrayglow
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our teenage church group to stay at during a summer trip. The rooms were so nice and comfy. Two bathrooms! Which was a dream come true for the girl room with 5 girls! The kitchen was extremely helpful and had everything I needed. I have no complaints at all and plan on staying here everytime we come to Dallas. The staff was wonderful and the breakfast was delicious and had a lot to choose from! A great place to stay for your budget! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: CP2001
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay as close to the airport on our final night in Dallas as possible. When we arrived to check in that afternoon, the hotel staff seemed pleasant enough. As we made our way to our room, we noticed that the majority of the hotel was in bad shape. When we walked in to the room, it appeared to be fairly clean though extremely outdated and the room had a mildew smell. The room had a partition slider and as we tested it, we found ourselves stranded on the bedroom side of the room. We called the front desk to ask for assistance and while the maintence man came, we noticed beer bottles with cigarette butts all over the patio area. Needless to say we ended up leaving immediately. The staff gave us a full refund but made no apologies for the condition of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the heart of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Hoha1
Reviews.Content: Nice big rooms with plenty of storage space, complete with full kitchen and full size refrigerators.Swimming pull comes handy on those hot Texas days.Free food and drinks served almost daily in reception area, hot breakfast in the morning isn't bad with good coffee selection. Stuff is friendly and helpful making sure you are going to enjoy your stay here. Just the best bang for your buck in the area period. Brittany Quin or Steven Ramirez at the front desk will always come through for you weather you need directions or advice on local dining options. Definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: aeroanne
Reviews.Content: In town for the volleyball tourny and for the price found this place to be perfect - 6 miles from convention center and easy access around town - rooms clean and decent breakfast - wish pool was bigger and landscaping could be kept up more but overall would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love it and will go back!”
Reviews.Author: clwalder
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after graduating and before starting a new job. I was also celebrating my birthday! I called and spoke to Brittany, and she was very professional and helpful on the phone. Her friendlyness and attention to detail i swaht sold me on staying here. Once I got there the room was nice and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I would stay here and reccomend to others to stay here! Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately Return!”
Reviews.Author: troubledwench
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a suite with a king sized bed, which included a little kitchenette, and living room area with a fireplace--we did not need it in april, but if it were winter, it would have been lovely to sit with a burning fire in the fireplace! the room was compact, but spacious enough that I commented to my spouse that if it were only he and I, we could live in a place like this year round! it was clean, well maintained, quiet, cozy, and defintely affordable--had our kids been with us, we would have opted for the loft unit, which was awesome too--our friend stayed in a loft suite! All in all, it was a very positive experience! Thank you Hawthorne suites!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, comfortable, and great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: JBMateo
Reviews.Content: On our way back from Cancun, we stayed at this Hotel for 3 nights in April. The room were surprising big with separate area to lounge on or work on your Laptop with the free Wi-Fi from the Hotel. The kitchen was nicely equipped to warm up Pizzas or make late night snacks. There is also a McDonalds and a Jack-in-the box walking distance away. No need to worry about breakfast though--the Hotel provides a tasty breakfast, which varies from day to day and above all it was free. We landed in DFW, and the hotel was about 20 minutes away-- it was nice that we could drive to down town in about the same time. Highly recommended place to stay, we will certainly stay here the next time in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like you are seeing friends”
Reviews.Author: WallyR48
Reviews.Content: The staff both morning and evening are very friendly and remember who you are. The are always courteous and helpful. No hassles which is great when you are traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Price and A Gem”
Reviews.Author: Longdrycreek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days and then one day. The first room was very nice and comfortable. Not a 5 Star hotel or even a 4 Star but I found the beds comfortable the the room comfortable. Internet is a gem. The breakfast buffet is adequate and the staff absolutely courteous and friendly. The grounds need attention but I do not sleep on the grounds. However, whatever is lost , as some of the reviewers complain about, I am not disturbed. I carry extra amenities, so I am set. If value a good room at a very reasonable price and enjoy the solitude and quiet of this hotel, enjoy it. I hope your experience matches mine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jody56_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five nights. centrally located and close to almost all amenities. Very family oriented and clean hotel. The rooms are big and spacious and each suite is equiped with kitchen and full washroom.Some Suited have 2 floors and have 2 fill washrooms and they all have large living area and flat tv. Staff is very friendly and helpful, especially the housekeeping staff was so good. They cleaned our room daily and went out of their way to make sure everything is in working condition. Their shuttle to the Love field airport is a bonus, its so convenient and the driver was very courteous. They have good breakfast daily and the eating area is very clean and they have plenty of food. The facility is smoke free and there is no loud music or any other kind of noise in the area, one can get a very good night sleep. Plenty of free parking as well. I would certainly stay there when I visit Dallas again.

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kaka54
Reviews.Content: we had a wedding to attend rooms are spacious.cutomer service was excellent.manager put extra effort to get us food even late at night.we could not get better place for the price we paid .will surely stay here next trip to Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: jv4656
Reviews.Content: Was attending a work related training in the Park Cities area. Decided to stay at Hawthorn Suites based on it being fairly close, and what seemed like a really decent price. Property looks like a converted apartment complex. I stayed in a one room suite, which had a small kitchen, and small living room. Unit had a dated feel to it, and smell if that makes sense. However, for what i payed for it, I was fairly happy. It was better then a budget motel, but not anything fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Its Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Madhu1312
Reviews.Content: When I checked in and got to my room and saw, it was Wow! It has a spacious room a full kitchen with all required things. A big closet with plenty of room. Everyday Hot breakfast was available. The shuttle was provided to pick up and drop to my office also they took us to near by place like any grocessory store, or bank. I have stayed at this hotel twice for 3 months each and find it very comfortable and best place to stay, Good room services were provided. Good internet facility. The staff was very cooperative, Gave any information needed, helped us in lot of things. Hawthron suites is a Great place to stay and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, but...”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_from_Omaha
Reviews.Content: I was mostly pleased with this hotel. Other reviewers have noted the place was dated, and it is. I was OK with that. I do not need the latest TV in the room to be happy. I did have 2 primary complaints. The room was very drafty, and we had no hot water to the downstairs portion of the suite. I called the front desk twice, and the problem was still not fixed when we left 3 days later despite assurances it would be fixed. It was not the end of the world as the upstairs bathroom had hot water, but it was inconvenient for washing dishes, and I REALLY hate being lied to by the front desk people. I wish the room numbers would have been better marked on the end of the building. Once we found building 900, there were absolutely no markings anywhere on the building to designate the room numbers. The room numbers were small, hard-to-read numbers posted at the door. I had to wander around each side of the building until I got lucky, and spotted room 926. As someone noted earlier, the neighborhood left a bit to be desired. That being said, we had no security problems of any sort. The beds were phenomenal, and I slept like a baby! Despite the hotel being 100% full, there were no noise issues. The wireless internet should be better secured. A 5 digit numeric code is easily hacked. I would most likely stay there again, but if the hot water problem is not resolved, I would cut my stay short. Pretty good value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Really great value”
Reviews.Author: AshleyNAplin
Reviews.Content: I rented a room for $59 through Priceline.com and I was very pleasantly surprised to see the size of the room, full kitchen, big closet, flat screen tv when I walked in. I didn't come in with enormous expectations (this isn't the Ritz-Carlton afterall) and I didn't come to Dallas to hang out in the hotel room. But, I was comfortable, the staff was helpful, got free wifi, it was very quiet, and I couldnt beat the price. One thing I wished I had asked for was to be on the top floor or in the building with the lobby. This is only because when you walk out your door you are outside and I am a 26 year girl who was staying by herself. Although, I can't say anything ever made me feel unsafe while I was there (I am just overly cautious). It was convenient to get back to Dallas Love Field as well as to the downtown/uptown area. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “converted apt.complex, opened to outside, door hard to close...”
Reviews.Author: owlpal
Reviews.Content: As tennis parents we have stayed in a variety of hotels and this one nearly takes the cake. As mentioned above, the door was hard to close enough to get the lock to engage and opened to the outside with security issues galore outside. The mattress on the bed was like plywood covered by batting. I dont think I have ever slept on one as hard.Breakfast was not out at 630 so we had to move on. As for price/ value about 40.00 would have been closer than what we had to pay- if we hadnt paid in advance through expedia we would not have stayed after checking in.The living room is separated by an acordian curtain. I am sooo surprised that Wyndom put their name on this one!

Reviews.Title: “Here for a Bowl Game”
Reviews.Author: Jnjtiger
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a fine value for family. Really an extended-stay, condo style hotel. Rooms were large, clean, with full kitchen. Upstairs, downstairs bedrooms, so kids were not right on top of adults. Easy to find location near Dallas Love Field and although not really near Cotton Bowl, took us 10 minutes to drive there. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “really nice & comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: newyoika
Reviews.Content: i thoroughly enjoyed my stay here & have no complaints. the room was very spacious, clean, and comfortable. with a full kitchen, fireplace, sofa/living room area. free parking & free wifi (which worked great). friendly & helpful staff. incredible price. only suggestion i have is to provide "do not disturb" signs so housekeeping doesn't come knocking at noon. would stay again for sure if i needed a hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, A Little Dated”
Reviews.Author: RazorMama
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this particular hotel over the Thanksgiving holiday. We were in a 2 bedroom, but I don't know that I would actually call it that at all. It was an odd layout as there is an upstairs. There aren't actually bedrooms, more like a studio room below with a bed and a loft with a bed; it is all open. The room(s) were clean and it served its purpose for us. The entryway to our room was behind the building and the lights were not functioning on the outside, so that was a little scary. There were some features that were modern, like a new dishwasher in the unit, but the stove and microwave were VERY dated. I am guessing mid -1980s models. The right side of our kitchen sink had a leaky pipe and we only found that out after i noticed I was standing in a puddle of water that was pouring out from under the sink. The upstairs bathroom door visibly had a fist hole in it that was very poorly patched. Couldn't they just replace the door? We ate breakfast one morning but it was average at best so we opted to purchase our own breakfast foods for the remainder of our stay. All in all, it was an average place to stay. The staff was friendly. We will probably not return there next year. If you are looking for a true 2BR hotel with modern conveniences, I would recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “THE PEOPLE ARE THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: kzcoder
Reviews.Content: The Manager and the guy that works the 2nd shift during the week are excellent and very hard to come by these days. The customer service is excellent. You can't always judge a book by it's cover. The rooms are clean and nice, love the fireplace and full kitchen

Reviews.Title: “These people wrote the book on Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: StayLost
Reviews.Content: Had to dive up to Dallas for an unexpected trip and was looking for affordable accommodations when I booked with the Hawthorn Suits. I chose the property because the price was unbeatable and the location is minutes from downtown. This hotel completely exceeded my expectationsâ€” plain and simple. The staff was just amazing! The front desk made the check-in process very easy. I was shocked when I was offered complimentary beer and wine. I was even more shocked when they told me dinner would be served during my stay, and the food was so incredible! It was really awesome to have a home-cooked meal when traveling and couldnâ€™t believe that there was no charge for it. As for my room, it was spacious and updated. One thing I dread about staying in a hotel is an uncomfortable mattress, but my bed was perfect. Great TV lineup and WIFI worked like a charm. The first night I requested some extra towels and Rita, a member of housekeeping staff, was so nice to leave me extra towels every night of my stay. They really made me feel like family! I would have stayed here just for the free shuttle service. It was a life-saver! The driver took me anywhere I wanted to go in the area! It really relieved a lot of stress not having to deal with getting lost in Dallas traffic! I just canâ€™t say enough great things about my experience here. Itâ€™s really nice to stay at a place where they really take care of their customers. Canâ€™t wait to come back and visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a place for single travelers”
Reviews.Author: kateydid50
Reviews.Content: Based on a 2-1/2 star rating, I was initially impressed with the price, but upon arrival saw why. The hotel is off the beaten path with dark parking lots and outdoor room access. As a single female traveler, I did not feel safe at all going in and out of my room in the evening. Rooms were OK. Clean but old - cigarette burns in the carpeting and older light fixtures and plumbing. Walls were pretty thin and sleep was minimal due to loud guests and people walking past your outside door late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Would look otherwhere”
Reviews.Author: Danny_il
Reviews.Content: Based on price/reviews in Trip advisor, we took this hotel Though Trip Advisor has a near 100% success rate for us , this one missed the target We arrived after flying in from Atlanta. Front desk were very friendly Given our key, we to our first room. Air conditioning wasn't operating properly Went to second room , door didn't lock and there were wasps Finally we got to our third room, not the greatest but we were tired of changing rooms (no elevator and were were shleping 4 pieces of large luggage) Breakfast is no frills - though the dining room is clean And as I mentioned, the staff are very nice and patient. Location is good So, I guess my expectations were high and therefore the disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Best hidden Gem in the Dallas area!”
Reviews.Author: kemadev
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take a minute and create an account just to write a review for this hotel. First off thank Tripadvisor for letting me know the details about this hotel or I might have gone somewhere else. Second, it is 10 minutes from the airport. By the time I got from my plane to pick up my luggage they where waiting for me. When we got to the hotel I noticed that it was off a main road (Mockingbird) and I35. What's great about that is that when I had clients meet me at the hotel they found it very easy to get to but had never heard of the hotel. (Off the beaten path) Then I checked in and got to my room and Wow! This is a steal. One client told me this place is better than her apartment! Fireplace, big desk and very comfortable chair, pull out sofa, full kitchen with all the necessities. Did I mention the walk in closet. Plenty of room. The staff was great, every night they had complimentary beer and wine. Hot breakfast but I saved the best for last. The shuttle will take you and pick you up Anywhere you want to go within a 5 mile radius! I saw this in another review on this site and tested it. It's true! I went to dinner, the grocery store as well as took in a little entertainment (if you know what I mean). This is my hotel when I go to Dallas. I found that some people have lived at this place for months and some have been there for 2 years. I understand why. Great place to stay and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good value extended stay property”
Reviews.Author: Chris072
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets an excellent rating because it was so inexpensive ($49 per night) and had a full kitchen. A bit dated, but decent breakfast, decent staff, fireplace, free wi-fi, laundry facilities, and clean. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to spend some "home away from home" time with my son”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseySunset
Reviews.Content: I had a last minute opportunity to visit my son who is attending tech school at Sheppard AFB for 4 day weekend over the 4th of July holiday. I used Trip Advisor to find a place to stay and came across this place. It seemed to good to be true, but I've always had good experiences with the hotels I've booked through this site. so I made my reservation. I wanted my son to feel relaxed and as close to "home" as possible and not like we were staying at a hotel, which is exactly what it was like. When we arrived at Hawthorn Suites on Friday evening to check in a thunderstorm hit. The young men working that night offered us a drink, turned the TV on in the room where they served breakfast and told us to relax while we waited for the rain to slow down. They knew we were tired and hungry from a day of traveling and told us about a great place to order home cooked meals to be delivered to our room (excellent steak dinner) . When we walked into our room it was perfect - it was a small apartment. A living room, kitchen, bath, and bedroom with a walk in closet. The sofa was a pull out bed and there was a sliding door that separated the bedroom from the living room. We sat on the sofa watched TV and talked til late into the night. It was great. The hotel offered free breakfast every morning but it was awesome to cook breakfast for my boy again and sit and eat breakfast with him in our room. Every person that we met who worked there was fantastic. Everyone was friendly and personable, helpful with directions, printed information off the computer for us and made the trip really nice. It was easy to get anywhere we wanted to go from the location, the pool was clean and our experience there was great. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and would stay there again if I am lucky enough to get back to that area

Reviews.Title: “decent place”
Reviews.Author: faeriehazel
Reviews.Content: I was stranded in Dallas for a night (thanks for nothing, Continental!) and ended up staying here - they had special rates for distressed passengers. Pros: close to the airport, friendly staff, rooms are spacious and clean. Cons: The ceiling kept creaking every time the person above me moved around - not very loud, but enough to notice. The wifi didn't work in my room. Also these are suites and all in separate buildings, which can be a little scary if you are a female traveler and have watched too much Criminal Minds. All in all, it was pretty good. If I am ever stranded in Dallas again I know where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Exception staff, top notch customer service.”
Reviews.Author: jackie55711
Reviews.Content: Great hotel & staff. They were very courteous & helpful. From the first contact in planning a nursing class reunion, they were exceptional in all areas. Rooms were clean & food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond my wildest dreams”
Reviews.Author: Werthie
Reviews.Content: Sean and his team, Elias, John , Frankie, Kenny, Angelica and Maria treated us like visiting royalty. We were there for our 50th reunion having graduated from Parkland Nursing in 1960. We had people with wheelchairs, walkers, oxygen and able bodied people. We were given every courtesy. The room I stayed in 613 was clean and tastefully appointed. The food was excellent and delightfully presented. Everyone there acted as if they were glad to see us. Thank you for a lovely two nights. The shuttle was a life saver as most of us have not driven in Dallas for many years. I have sent your contact information to the planners of the reunion for next year. I will be back to stay with you when I am in Dallas for other reasons. Margaret Williams, RN

Reviews.Title: “Superior Value, hope it stays that way.”
Reviews.Author: davidinmurfreesboro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right near many access points of downtown. The hotel looks just like an apartment complex, so when you see it, you dont think hotel at all, and its tucked behind heavy professional office class b office buildings. The rooms are very large, its almost to much like home, because you have a full bed, full kitchen, living room, powder room, balcony etc. The beds are very very comfortable, clean, well kept, and is a professional place. Clearly the best price for the area, and best value i think if your trying to get a hotel in the 60-80 range. The breakfast is good, not great, but not bad either, just average. They have free beer and wine i think on wednesday nights. Free shuttle to Love is a plus too. They go out of their way to help you, and the front desk guys at night are the BEST!. I highly recommend this hotel, and you will save 50 percent over other hotels that give less service and 10 time the attitude. Again, if your here for business, stay here because you will get all the bells and wissles at half the price of anything else this high quality. With all these great reviews, i fear they are going to raise their rates. Please stay a great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Elias at the front desk was extremely...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Elias at the front desk was extremely courteous and professional! The room was spacious and clean! We enjoyed our stay and highly recommend this hotel for a one night or extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lhoudashell
Reviews.Content: I realized when I got to the airport that I had forgotten my phone, and Jessie used his own car to drive it to me before my flight. This type of customer service is almost unheard of, so next time I am in Dallas I will be staying there. Thanks again, Jessie

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience at Hawthorne Suites, Dallas, TX!!!”
Reviews.Author: ceokarens
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hawthorne Suites in Dallas Texas this week for the Wind Conference and Exhibition. They absolutely spoiled me during my stay. I had a wonderful studio apartment style room with a walk in closet, fireplace, desk area, full kitchen with snack bar seating, full bathroom and ability to pull a screen to separate the bedroom area from the "front room" area. The bed was comfy with a lovely comforter and comfortable pillows. I had access ability to all day "limousine" service whether I needed to go to a Walgreens, Airport, Convention Center at a particular time or be picked up from an event to be brought back to their location. I woke up to a great "home made" breakfast buffet with plenty of choices and pleasant attitudes that treated me like family...and the price was unbelievable! The guests along with the staff treated each other like family. I must say, I never had such a great experience during a stay at any other facility...and the price, under $100.00. I offered to treat the crew to a pizza dinner since they weren't very open to tipping, but they said they were just doing their job. On my last trip to the airport I decided to just leave a tip in their van cup holder. Thank you, Hawthorne Suites, Dallas TX! What a great team! I wish you each great success!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mbettis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hawthorn several times. The staff are great. They treat you like a returning friend. Everything is very clean. The hotel is older but well kept. The perfect place to stay when you would like to be able to make coffee or a light meal instead of eating out. Nice kitchen with full refrigerator and stove. The breakfasts served by the hotel are great. Real scrambled eggs! Our sty here began from having a family memb er in Baylor Hospital which is about 10 minutes away. They have a shuttle to the shopital as well as Love Field. This is also a fairly quiet place with plenty of room to walk within the complex. The best thing is the friendliness and helpfullness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Personal attention, personal attention, personal attention!!!”
Reviews.Author: john1967
Reviews.Content: My Mother recently underwent open-heart surgery in Dallas, so my Father and I spent about 8 or 9 days at Hawthorn Suites, Dallas Love Field. The personal service we received here was unmatched by any other hotel I have stayed at in all my 43 years. The rooms were clean and well maintained during our stay. Our suite had a full kitchen with four burner range, oven, and full sized refridgerator/freezer with icemaker. The buffet breakfasts were excellent and it wasn't cereal and muffins. We are talking eggs, bisquits and gravy, bacon, sausage, real potatoes, waffles, fresh fruit, four kinds of cereal, milk, and juice. I never missed a FULL home cooked breakfast once during our stay. The shuttle driver was prompt and friendly and even offered to keep my Mom in his prayers. The front desk personel went above and beyond the call of duty on a daily basis to make sure we had everything we needed and to help with directions, maps, entertainment for when my wife visited, and restaurant advise. They even found me a short cut to the hospital that kept me off the main roads as I am not used to driving in such a big city. I never went through the lobby or parking lot that someone on staff didn't stop me to ask how my Mother was doing. They even sent flowers to our home the day after we got back. I was so pleased by the service that I wrote a letter to the general manager and one to the customer sevice corporate headquarters thanking them for the way we were treated and how much this staff helped us make it through such a difficult time for our family. Any time I am in the Dallas area in the future, I will have no problems choosing a place to stay. Again, many thanks to all the wonderful people at Hawthorn Suites!!!

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: canterbury_girl35
Reviews.Content: During the process of moving to Dallas from Seattle I was in search of a safe and quiet place to call home while my permanent residence was under construction. One afternoon I spent several hours looking at different hotels and apartments when I happened onto Hawthorn Suites and my first impression was amazing. I was greeted promptly and spoke directly to the manager about the rates for my 3 month stay. I also questioned the pet policy/fee as I needed a place that would allow me to have my 2 kittens in the room with me. The pet fee was minimal; compared to other places I looked into around the area. On the day of check-in to the hotel, I was again greeted promptly and respectfully by the staff. The room I was placed in was in the back of the building where it was quiet and I felt like I was at home. During this stay I did indeed bring my kittens to Dallas and since they came on a Tuesday (which is the full service housekeeping day) I requested that my room not be serviced so that I could allow my kittens to adjust to their new surroundings. Once they settled in they loved to visit the staff in the hotel and they felt comfortable in the room that they were inâ€¦.. All in all my stay at Hawthorne was excellent. The social nights were fun and breakfast was always delicious. I would recommend this hotel to any guest who needs a place to call home for a long extended trip.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience. will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: rahila1117
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay here for 13 weeks for my job. I was here with my sister and dog and was charged a $50 pet fee which i guess wasnt bad compared to other hotels. when I arrived in my room. It seemed like they had given me the worst room on the property. It looked run down, dirty and very cheap. We didnt have hot water in the kitchen or bathroom sinks so we would wash our hands and face with freezing cold water. I called the front desk and the manager ( Keith) said that I just have to let it run a while. It never worked. One thursday on my day off, without any warning the water went out and I was w/o any water for 10 hours. I couldnt even flush my tolet let alone wash my hands. If i called the front desk then those people would be rude. NO apology. I had a dog and i would walk him ever morning for an hour outside the property by the bayou and they accused me of letting him poop all over the property. That was just so they could get more money out of me at the end. After 3 1/2 weeks I again didnt have water for 2 days. It went out tuesday evening again w/o any notice and there was no water wednesday morning. I checked out wednesday noon. This guy ( SEAN) who works there at the desk in the morning is very rude and dishonest. He didnt want to give me my final bill so I had to come by the next day. I called them on thursday and he told me that they are charging me $150 for some stains in the room. I told them the stains were already there but aparantly they had taken some pictures of the room and he kept saying that they have evidence. The night I checked in Keith did not tell me I was supposed to let him know of stains or any problems in the room but when it came time to check out they slapped me with a $150 fine. I tried to talk to the manager but he didnt want to deal with it. My credit card was like a blank check to them so they could charge me whatever they wanted. The people at this hotel are very dishonest and rude. Think twice b4 u give them your credit card. Also they dont provide a DVD player so I went and bought my own and when I tried to hook it up their TV was soo old that it didnt have any DVD connections.. I did get it replaced. I think they have a gym but you have to go to some other building and also the pool is very dirty and small. They had the same thing every day for breakfast..sausage or bacon. potatoes, cereal and waffles that you have to make yourself. No orange juice ..sunny D. Its a run down apartment complex that they have made into a hotel. These people have no problem lying about anything. Half the time the internet didnt work either. I was told that there was a problem with the routher but they didnt do anything. Dont stay here. Spend a little more somewhere else and you will be happier because you may end up paying more here than you initially thought.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: ilovedaisys
Reviews.Content: We have been staying here at hawthorne for almost 3 weeks now, my husband is gone all day working and our 3 yr old and i stay at the hotel during the day until he gets home. The staff at the front desk is always more than accomodating and very personable; every morning when we go down and eat breakfast my daughter has to see Angelica (the cook) and give her a hug and tell her thank you for breakfast, she will literally not leave until she has seen Angelica! The breakfast is always very plentiful and tastes amazing (buscuits, sometimes gravy, bacon, sausage, eggs, waffles, bagels, toast, multiple cereals, oj, cofffee, and milk) We love to go to social hour on wednesday nights, eat dinner and mingle with the other guests and the staff (there are a lot of long term guests here and it really makes you feel like your having dinner with the family) I read below that someone felt the area was unsafe for her family and young children, however, my 3 yr old and i go for walks almost daily around the area, there is even a lovely little creek that runs just behind the property and there are always lots of little ducks down there to watch. and the pool is inclosed by a fence for safety so that young children can not get to it while unsupervised. (not that i quite understand why a child would be outside of a hotel unsupervised in the first place?no matter how safe the area.) Our room gets cleaned 2 times a week since we are long term guests and the house keeping staff is always very friendly and makes sure that everything is stocked for you, and during the week if you run out of anything whoever is at the front desk is always more than willing to help whether it be dish washer detergent, towels, paper, etc. and if they dont have it. they will go out and buy it (neccessities anyway) Our stay here has been more than enjoyable and hawthorne and its staff have blown our expectations out of the water. If you choose to stay here you can plan on having a home away from home everytime you are in dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service & accomodations - We will be back next year!!!”
Reviews.Author: SDCheerMom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hawthorn Suites for a cheerleading competition. Hawthorn Suites was exactly what we were looking for! The staff was amazing - Keith and Tom were so accommodating - they responded to any and all requests/needs from our group. Their shuttle service was great - driver Kenny and others not only got us to and from the airport - they also brought us all daily to and from the Dallas Convention Center for our competition. The grocery store and any other stops we desired were also offered! The rooms were great - well equipped kitchen, cozy fireplace and amazingly comfortable beds - I slept like a baby the entire time we were there. It was also extremely quiet. The breakfast and dinner meals provided were just icing on the cake. We were very happy with this hotel and our team plans on going back next year for competition!!! You just cannot beat the amazing customer service we received here!! As for any negative reviews you may read, remember the posted warning signs in the parking lot advising all valueables not be left in car, etc. are a REQUIREMENT by the City of Dallas. This hotel is safe and I never felt alarmed. Further, it was February and had just finished snowing the weekend before we arrived - therefore, there is no expectation for any outdoor swimming pool to be available. We recommend Hawthorn Suites wholeheartedly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hometown Customer Service in the Big City”
Reviews.Author: Preacher44
Reviews.Content: The Hawthorn Suites-Love Field really has been for me the answer to prayer. I am a full-time seminary student at Texas Christian University in Fort Worth, and work in Dallas. The convenient location of this property to work, transportation, retail and entertainment is invaluable. There are many things that make this property special, the most important being the exemplary customer service exhibited by the General Manager and staff. No detail is too small for their meticulous attention. The lobby is always beautifully maintained, and they provide a delicious breakfast every morning. My room is spacious, comfortable, and well-appointed, with all the amenities that make it feel like home. I really appreciate the bright work and living area, with internet access that is included, as I do most of my study and writing here. And when I want to take in a concert at the symphony or an opera or play, the Hawthorn shuttle is always available to drop me off and pick me up. The staff here really make the effort to create a family atmosphere, which makes my time away from home feel less like work and more like home!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the reviews fool you!!!”
Reviews.Author: San_Diego2007
Reviews.Content: This is a TERRIBLE part of town, signs all over the parking lot warn you about the loss of any belongings. The hotel is beyond old, and in terrible shape. The rooms are NOT suites....they merely have a "curtain" that you separate your bed from your TV area!! This is not a place for children (the pool is empty, with dirt in it...obviously it has been a long time with no care). The signs in the parking lot scared us from the moment we got here....."take your belongings, take your keys,".......wow, serious warnings!! This is not a place to stay and feel any sense of relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “Not just a hotel - more like your own holiday home”
Reviews.Author: BayViewEngland
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for something more than just the same old same old when it comes to hotels, look no further than the Hawthorn Suites, Dallas (Brookriver Drive, just off W Mockingbird Lane). This property started out as an apartment complex, so now it's a hotel you get the spaciousness of staying in basically your own apartment. Although there were only two of us, the very friendly General Manager upgraded us on arrival to a 2-bed 2-bath duplex suite, with granite counter tops, balcony/terrace, fireplace and even a staircase to the upper level! How cool is that? Add into the mix a great complimentary breakfast, friendly, helpful staff, quiet leafy location and only about 10 minutes drive to downtown Dallas (on a good day!) and you get a combination that's just about impossible to beat. How much would you expect to pay for all this? Make a guess then cut it by half - I paid less than $70 a day with all taxes, fees etc included. Now that's what I call a superb deal!

Reviews.Title: “FEELS LIKE HOME!”
Reviews.Author: tmaruna01
Reviews.Content: I am a traveling healthcare provider and will be staying in Hawthorn suites for several weeks. From the day I landed here, I have felt at home. The staff here truly care and take pride in making their guest feel welcome. The rooms are clean and spacious. Breakfast is served daily and is absolutely wonderful. Guest are not rushed to finish their meals and sometimes the breakfast time is extended to accommodate the late arrivals. Parking is free and plentiful. The grounds are well kept, and secure. Fitness center and laundry on site. The staff are so friendly and sensitive to your needs, that alone means much to a weary traveler. I would highly recommend this hotel and would gladly stay again. Hawthorn Suites Dallas, "YOU ROCK!"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Facility”
Reviews.Author: spears76
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for 6 weeks at Hawthorne Suites, 7900 Brookriver Drive, Dallas Tx. The entire staff was wonderful. They made us feel like family. We got a great rate on the 2 bedroom suite, it was spacious and clean. Fully functioning kitchen with all the comforts of home. When we needed directions they printed out maps and told us the best route to take to get to where ever we needed or wanted to go. My nephew is a patient at Childrens Hospital, and they would call to check on us if they didn't see us that day,or to see if we needed anything. Some of the staff even came to play WII games with him. We were within a few miles of the clinics and the hospital. Fantastic breakfast every morning, and on Wednesday nights they cook a dinner for all the guest. We go back in a month and their is no question about where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Nette-Nette
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this place and ALL THE PEOPLE there...My son is a patient at a nearby hospital.. WE statyed at this hotel for about 2 months and never felt more at home in our life.. They made my family and son feel so welcome.. We will not ever look for another hotel to stay in as long as they are there.. We are going through a really bad time and the staff here went above and beyond to make us feel better.. We were sad to leave and we will keep in touch with them as we feel like they are our family.. A nice quiet enviroment to be in..

Reviews.Title: “Spacious for families”
Reviews.Author: minniemae
Reviews.Content: The outside appearance is dated and looks like they are working on it showly. The inside is truly very clean and spacious! We had a 2-story unit; more than enough for family of 4 (six can fit in here). It had a queen bed upstairs + own private bath with lots of closet space and room to roam. Another private bedroom downstairs w/ full bathroom. Fully furnished kitchen w/ ref, oven, microwave, dishwasher (dishes/utensils also provided). It's like an apartment/condo. The hotel site is relatively quiet but past the other side of the freeway is a questionable area. Not a whole lot of food places or things to do nearby. Laundry available. Full breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, TONS of extra space..almost like an apartment away from home! STAFF was UNBELIEVABLE!”
Reviews.Author: twizzlerr
Reviews.Content: My family chose this location for 5 nights based on the reviews from this site alone. I had previously called at talked to 4 other hotels in the area trying to make a decision, but once I spoke with the hotel staff at the Hawthorne, it was a no-brainer! **STAFF** First of all, let me say that all the positive feedback you may have read about Keith, Tom, and the entire staff a the Hawthorn Suites is TRUE! (They took over the property in November so anything negative you read before that...please understand that it was a different management company). They were so accommodating it was almost unbelievable. Having worked in the travel industry for 13 years, I know what level of service to expect. I have worked for Delta Airlines and worked as a travel agent, so I know this industry. They went so above and beyond what good customer service is, it was almost unheard of. I have only taken the time to write 1 online review in my life, but I knew I had to give credit where credit was do in complimenting & praising the staff at the Hawthorn Suites. I was there with a baseball team and they bent over backwards to make our kids' trip the best ever! He even had a huge canvas Welcome and Good Luck banner professionally MADE for our team and another team. It was hanging on the hotel exterior by the front door as we came in. Who does that in today's customer service world. They threw a big hamburger, hotdog, chips and dip social for our team and the other guests at the hotel. They took me to the airport to get my daughter who was flying in and they WAITED in the van while I went inside to get her. I told them they could leave and I'd get a way back, but they insisted. Just unbelievable. One afternoon, my young daughter and son went into the lobby vending machine to buy some Oreos. The staff there (I think it was Tom) saw how excited my kids were to have their Oreos...he said, "Would you like some milk to go with those Oreos?" Surprised, I said, "Well, sure." He went into the back kitchen and came back with 2 glasses of milk. Small gesture, BIG statement! These people really do care about making their guests number one. **ROOM LAYOUT** This hotel has such great reviews for a few reasons...the layout of all the rooms is a HUGE plus! We had 2 rooms, living area, full kitchen with pots, pans, plates, stove, oven, etc....the works! If you are on a business trip, staying one night or if your preference is fine luxuries, marble countertops, restaurant with bar, and a spa this may not be the place for you. If you want a place where the beds are new, SUPER comfortable, 3x the space you'd get in a standard hotel for a fraction of the price, free parking, free hot breakfast, laundry onsite, then you've found your place! I will say that they are renovating the entire property and are still in this process. The microwaves are definitely old school, but who cares really, so long as it heats and pops popcorn. Keith told me those are coming in soon. It is an ongoing process to renovate, paint, etc. a property, but the beds and showers are clean and neat. He even showed me the paint colors he is about to do on the exterior. **BREAKFAST** Angelica made a fantastic breakfast for us everyday! We had sausage, eggs, potatoes, breakfast burritos, and belgium waffles. There was fruit, cereal and juices as well. One thing I appreciated was the fact that even though they were closing in 15 minutes, she came out with a huge plate of eggs and bacon because there were still quite a few people hungry in the eating area. Most places shut down the last 15-20 minutes and make you feel like they are ready for you to leave. We tipped her at the end of the week and thanked her for feeding us so well. **OUTSIDE EXTERIOR** The outside does not look like some of the brand new properties yet, but they are working on it, so if that is the most important factor to you, you may be somewhat disappointed. I have stayed in some of the nicest properties all over the world..yes, I had a marble entry way and granite countertops, but really who cares. For most of my trips, and I can probably speak for a lot of people, I feel like most people usually want clean rooms, safe area, close and convenient to local attractions, (6 minutes from Dallas Love), and great management staff. You'll get that here at the Hawthorn Suites. We will most definitely be going back to the Hawthorn Suites again. We will always remember our All-Star tournament as such a wonderful event, and our stay with the folks at the Hawthorn made it all the better! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Shorty46
Reviews.Content: First of all, you will never find another breakfast bar better than Hawthorne Suites! Wonderful food! The breakfast room is very nice also, you don't have to wait for a table to sit at as you often do at other motels. Where else can you stay where they serve you dinner and have social hour one night a week? The pool area is very nice and clean. The staff are very accomodating and they are the friendliest people you will ever meet. The manager is wonderful and is there 24/7. They make you feel very welcome. The rooms are very nice too! I loved the fully equiped kitchen. The area is very nice too. The grounds are very well kept. Best place to stay in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Room and staff exceptional”
Reviews.Author: lizy11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in the Dallas area, I wish I had found this one sooner. The suite was clean, the bed was comfortable and the staff very helpful. We arrived late and hungry. Keith told us of restaurants in the area and of a Chinese Restaurant that delivered until 2 A.M., we ordered, if you like Chinese ask Keith for the number, the food was delicious! My next trip to Dallas I know where I'll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Mike9369
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spacious enough for two to unpack and spend a long weekend very comfortably. Staff was outstanding. Management was concerned for one thing only - the satisfaction of his guests, and went out of his way to ensure that satisfaction. Rooms were all clean, up to date, fresh, and comfortable. Location was convenient enough to get anywhere in the Dallas area with relative ease - only a block off of 35E. Quiet location, no neighborhood problems. Well worth staying at this location. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I NEEDED a cheap room with a shuttle to DAL”
Reviews.Author: avgold
Reviews.Content: very decent place--shuttle driver offered to make any stops i needed on the way from the airport, and offered to take me to my meeting later, a few miles away. place is more than adequate--paid $62 to stay here--full hot bacon and eggs breakfast included-- if this location works, the place is fine--all the workers were very nice--although i think i got bedbugs--not because the place was dirty, but you are right at ground level, with a lot of landscaping

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, rooms need a little updating”
Reviews.Author: claydawg21396
Reviews.Content: I was stuck at Dallas Love Airport due to Continental Airlines botched attempts to get me home (another story entirely). This hotel was one of the pre-negotiated hotels on the Continental list. I called for a shuttle. Promptly 8 minutes later the van was pulled right up to the curb to let me onboard. The shuttle driver (who is normally at the front desk but filled in to pick me up since it was after hours) noticed I had no bags (since Continental had sent them on without me) and asked if I needed anything. Given my distressed situation, the shuttle driver offered to stop at any restaurant or store I might need. I took him up on the offer and he recommended an excellent sushi restaurant not far down the street from the hotel. I placed an order for take-out and had a pleasant conversation with the shuttle driver while I waited for dinner. Check-in was a breeze. The rooms are just as everyone has said. Bigger than my first apartment out of college! The rooms do need upgraded furniture and appliances, but very clean and the beds were very comfortable. Complimentary breakfast of biscuits, gravy, southwestern eggs, sausage, cereals, coffee, jusices was prompt and was ready on time. It was hot, and best of all, free. Checkout was easy and a shuttle was there to take me back to the airport right on time. Overall, I was very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You just can not find a better accommodation at ANY price!”
Reviews.Author: Doogie4868
Reviews.Content: First off. The "rooms" are not rooms! They are mini apartments, full size fridge, stove and oven, dishwasher, even garbage disposal. Kitchen - complete with place settings, silver, pots, pans, paper towels.... you name it. Ok, ok...you have to stock the cupboards with your own food. My room has a walk in closet I could play raquetball in. Oh, did I mention the REAL fireplace? Ok, now for the good stuff. THE STAFF! WOW! I have stayed in some pretty high end hotels. I travel on business 100% of the time. I LIVE in hotels! This staff is WORLD CLASS!!! If you find better, I want to know about it. Actually, I bet the GM Keith would want to know about it. You see, he took over the property and it was in distress as he conveyed to me. He worked fast, furious, and spared no expense to do a complete U-Turn with this place. And it shows. It would be crazy to stay anywhere else. I will be here long term, likely up to a year. And I am LQQKING FORWARD TO IT!

Reviews.Title: “What a friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sun180
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hawthorn Suits for 6 weeks for work. Before arriving I was skeptical because of the reviews I read (before Decmber). But I was presently surprised upon arrival. The manager Keith gave me a warm welcome and upgraded me to a two bedroom suite. The whole management went over and beyond to meet every need. The room was clean a nice. It had a full kitchen, ample walk in closets and nice bathrooms with very good water pressure and plenty of clean towels. The fireplace was really nice. The gym was good and usually was not crowded. There were enough machines to work out. The swimming pool looked nice but it was too cold to swim The location is excellent. It is just off 35. It was not hard to reach the hotel even on bad icy days. Because of my work I returned to the hotel usually after midnight and felt completely safe there. The premise was clean. The hotel is undergoing major renovation but it did not disturb me at all. I felt like home there. All the staff especially Keith and John was very friendly. They readily made exceptions to meet individual needs. They were also very receptive to any complaints and fixed them very fast. I am going back to Dallas in May and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful, wonderful experience...”
Reviews.Author: drparkerhill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have done a great deal of travel in Europe, the Caribbean and the states and this stay ranks in our top ten hotel experience. The staff were extraordinary from our check-in clerk, John, to the manager, Keith, who came out personally to meet us. My husband, my 30-year-old son and I were in Dallas for the ASI convention at the Dallas Convention Center. While the hotel didn't normally offer shuttle service to the Convention Center 5 miles away, they made an exception and took us and picked us up both days. Our room was wonderful, extremely clean and offered a lot of the little things, like real Kleenex (not wood pulp), special neck pillows, a full-sized coffee pot and most importantly..independently controlled heat and air; as well as a full kitchen, extremely large walk-in closet, fireplace, wonderful mattress, coat closet and so much more. I am such a picky traveler with cleanliness of top-most importance and I was not disappointed. We felt like it wasn't a room, but a home. The bedroom area looked not dissimilar from ours at home. We understand the hotel is in the process of a major renovation, but it didn't interfere with our stay. Our room had yet to be updated, but we loved it just like it was. We were also told that the hotel was scheduled to be completely re-landscaped this year, but we thought it was already beautiful. We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 days at the Hawthorn and after staying in over 40 hotels in the Dallas area over the last 10 years, we will never again stay anywhere else. This is how a hotel should be run. Call the hotel directly for the best rate - we stayed mid-week for just $89. What a phenomenal value!

Reviews.Title: “Made work more enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: allworknoplay2day
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the kind and considerate staff- a working trip was made more enjoyable! With limited time in our room after a long day - we returned to find it clean and comfortable - and were always greeted by the friendly staff. Our request for fun places to dine and a have drinks were met with enthusiastic help and transportation! Even recieved printed copies of restaurant reviews for us to choose from without having asked! Enjoyed the taco bar immensely ! Felt like we had stayed with friends- thanks Keith and staff.!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: TequilaFlats
Reviews.Content: The staff is courteous and very hospitable. Management went over and above to meet all of my needs. I rank my stay at the Hawthorne above average with a wholesome enviroment. The fireplaces and excellent housekeeping habits were a plus! RR

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sikoea64
Reviews.Content: This property is comfortable and cozy. The suite I stayed in was an apartment set-up. walked into a living room dressed with a working fireplace, to the right was clean galley kitchen with a dishwasher, a bathroom and a king bedroom with a walk-in closet. When I am in the area this will be my preference of choice especially due to the Front-Office Staff and Management. They would give you their shirt off their back, but jump hoops before they go there, LOL. Needless to say I had wonderful stay and recommend to stay there for your travel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy in Texas”
Reviews.Author: Littlelady1411
Reviews.Content: We contacted Hawthorn Suites and was supprised by the friendly and corporative voice on the other end of the phone. We had called other hotels before this one that was in no interest of having my business. My son was being released from the Children's hospital so we needed something close and afordable. Hawthorn Suites met all of our needs and more. The Manager Keith was wonderful, and polite. On entering, the office was inviting and John at the front desk was just as nice. The property is set up like small apartments so you only have a few people staying close to you, making it more private and peaceful. We booked a two bedroom suite. Our room was two story with a patio and bathroom on both floors. We also had a fireplace, full kitchen, sleeper sofa, and lots of closet space. Our room was recently remodeled with new furniture, carpet, and paint as most of the rooms are. We stayed for ten days and loved everyday. No contential breakfast here, you get the real deal, a hot breakfast every morning. The kids enjoyed it as much as the parents did. We loved it so much we recommended it to both sets of our parents to come visit for the holidays. Keith placed them in our building so we could all be close together. You will never meet a nicer crew than the crew at Hawthorn Suites in Dallas. Yes, I will happly return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Hawthorne Suites Here.......”
Reviews.Author: usflyer
Reviews.Content: Overview: Family member was having a procedure at the hospital and they had special rates here - think it was about $90 per night. GOOD: - Pretty close to the hospital. - In accordance with the suite concept, the rooms were pretty large with a full kitchen (looked out of the 80s), living room w/ TV, Couch, and Desk, and bedroom, bathroom. - Breakfast buffet was nice with pre-made omeletts, giant sausage patties, biscuits, gravy, oatmeal, etc. Nice! BAD: - Not a great part of town. We actually had some "working girls" in this hotel who had different men with them every morning at breakfast. Beer bottles, trash, etc was strewn about the perimeter of the property. - Not a clean and fresh room. The carpet had stains, the bathroom was small and old, the kitchen was old, and I found old medicine cups behind the drapes. Let's just say I didn't take off my socks and kept my suitcase off the ground. BOTTOM LINE: There are a lot of other hotels in the area, and even the hospital had rates for about $10 higher at other places. Next time, spend a little extra and get a LOT more.
